to properly format the document.

229.80.text: Earlier I mentioned that PDF tags are generated from Word Styles.

234.16.text: If we screw around with the styles and save the document,

236.88.text:
it will probably look weird
on someone else’s version of Word.

240.60.text:
This happens because each Word document uses
something called a “Template.”

244.94.text:
Each template stores the way the look and
feel of the document

248.10.text: is presented when users open up your Word document.

251.00.text:
Now, by default, the template that all new documents 
in Word uses is called “Normal.”

255.98.text: So if we overwrite the way the content looks here,

259.02.text:
it will only work for OUR version of
Word, using OUR normal template.

262.75.text:
To fix this, we’ll need to create our own
Template and use that to make it work for

267.56.text:
anybody we give this to.
So let’s start to make a Template by going

272.90.text:
In the Save As window of 
Word 2013, click on Browse.

277.46.text: In the Save As dialog box,

280.18.text:
activate the “SAVE AS” drop down 
and select WORD TEMPLATE.

284.26.text:
When you choose this, it should 
now open a folder for Templates.

288.48.text: This location will be important later so take note of it.

291.92.text: I’ve set up mine as "Custom Office Templates”

295.12.text: and made the location a favorite for later use.

299.62.text:
Next, let’s resave the document
 as a plain old word file,

303.20.text:
because we can make changes
to the Template right from within Word.

306.22.text:
Go to FILE > SAVE AS.
Then click on Browse again.

310.02.text:
Change the SAVE AS TYPE drop down to Word
File, and save it wherever you want.

In the Word Options Dialog Box, 
on the left side menu, choose ADD-INS.

In The TEMPLATES AND ADD-INS dialog box,
under the TEMPLATES tab...

335.58.text:
under the heading DOCUMENT TEMPLATE,

Find the Template you saved earlier and click Open.

342.72.text:
changes from NORMAL 
to the folder location of your Template.

345.86.text: Now choose OK or press ENTER.

If you’re in the business of

and a NUMBER, and all CHARACTER STYLES

1139.92.text: each number referencing a particular heading level.
